meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a hag.
meanings.sent1: The old witch in the story had a haggish appearance.
meanings.sent2: Her haggish cackle echoed through the dark forest.
meanings.sent3: The haggish costume at the party was both spooky and funny.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house had a haggish feel, as if it held secrets of the past.
meanings.sent5: The haggish figure in the painting seemed to come to life in the dim light.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities or appearance of a hag.
meanings.sent1: The haggish old woman lived alone in the woods.
meanings.sent2: The haggish character in the movie scared the children.
meanings.sent3: Despite her haggish looks, she had a kind heart.
meanings.sent4: The haggish laughter sent shivers down their spines.
meanings.sent5: The haggish figure in the fog seemed to beckon them closer.
